info.title: oneid-es-1-p-restapi
info.description:
OI description

Some useful links:
- [One Identity repository](https://github.com/pagopa/oneidentity)
- [The source API definition for OI](https://github.com/pagopa/oneidentity/blob/master/src/main/resources/openapi.yaml)

SAMLResponse.description: This is the 'SAMLResponse' of the requesting AUTHnreq.

RelayState.description: This is the 'RelayState' which identify the service requested. https://docs.italia.it/italia/spid/spid-regole-tecniche/it/stabile/trasmissione.html

default_acr_values.description: list of the Authentication Context Class References that this RP supports

saml_requested_attributes.description: Custom parameter which return all SPID attributes selected, https://docs.italia.it/italia/spid/spid-regole-tecniche/it/stabile/attributi.html

keys.description: JWK set in JSON array format

idp.description: This is the requested 'idp' to initiate the authentication flow

client_id.description: This is the 'client_id' of the requesting client. Maximum 255 characters.

response_type.description: MUST be one of the listed available values. Any response_type other than 'code' or 'token' is only supported in conjunction with scope=openid. As per the OAuth specification: 'code' is used for authorization code grant type flow, 'token' is used for implicit grant type flow, 'token id_token' is an extension provided by OpenID Connect, and 'code id_token', 'id_token', and 'none' are extensions provided by OpenID Connect Multiple Response Types

redirect_uri.description: The 'redirect_uri' that was registered for this client. It is required if multiple redirect_uri's have been registered for this client. If the scope contains openid, this field becomes MANDATORY.

scope.description: Only SCOPE values that were registered for this client will be granted. If only non-matching SCOPE values are requested, the request will fail.

state.description: Value opaque to the server, used by the client to track its session. It will be returned as received.

nonce.description: This is required for response_type 'token id_token'.  Typically, in an OpenID authorization scheme, the nonce represents a cryptographically strong random  string that is used to prevent intercepted responses from being reused.

access_token.description: The Access Token for the given token request

id_token.description: If the requested SCOPE included 'msso' or 'openid', response includes an id_token

id_token_type.description: If the requested SCOPE included 'msso' or 'openid', response includes an id_token_type

redirect_uri.description: Required if grant_type is authorization_code. Must contain a valid auth code

grant_type.description: For grant_type=authorization_code: client_id, client_secret, code, and redirect_uri are required.

userinfo_endpoint.description: URL of the user info endpoint

jwks_uri.description: URL of JSON Web Key Set document

scopes_supported.description: list of the OAuth 2.0 scope values that this server supports

subject_types_supported.description: list of the Subject Identifier types that this OP supports

token_endpoint.description: URL of the OAuth 2.0 token endpoint

id_token_signing_alg_values_supported.description: list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) supported by the OP for the ID Token to encode the Claims in a JWT

response_types_supported.description: ist of the OAuth 2.0 response_type values that this OP supports

claims_supported.description: list of the Claim Names of the Claims that the OpenID Provider MAY be able to supply values for

authorization_endpoint.description: URL of the OAuth 2.0 authorization endpoint

issuer.description: the identifier of the token's issuer. This is identical to the 'iss' Claim value in ID Tokens

grant_types_supported.description: list of the OAuth 2.0 Grant Type values that this OP supports

acr_values_supported.description: list of the Authentication Context Class References that this OP supports

token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported.description: list of Client Authentication methods supported by this Token Endpoint

token_endpoint_auth_signing_alg_values_s.description: list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) supported by the Token Endpoint for the signature on the JWT used to authenticate the Client at the Token Endpoint for the private_key_jwt and client_secret_jwt authentication methods. Servers SHOULD support RS256. The value none MUST NOT be used.

display_values_supported.description: list of the display parameter values that the OpenID Provider supports

claim_types_supported.description: list of the Claim Types that the OpenID Provider supports

service_documentation.description: URL of a page containing human-readable information that developers might want or need to know when using the OpenID Provider

ui_locales_supported.description: Languages and scripts supported for the user interface

OpenIDDiscovery.description: The OpenID configuration document as defined by the specification: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html#ProviderMetadata

start.description: The start timestamp for the status period.

end.description: The end timestamp for the status period.

status.description: The status value for the specified period.
